greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of tilings of a 3k X n rectangle using 3n k-ominoes of shape I; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..35, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local d, k; d:= nops(l)/3;
else for k while l[k]>0 do od;
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = Module[{d = Length[l]/3, k}, Which[n == 0, 1,  Min[l] > 0, Function[{m}, b[n-m, l-m]][Min[l]], True, For[k=1, l[[k]] > 0 , k++]; If[n<d, 0, b[n, ReplacePart[l, k -> d]]] + If[d == 1 || k > 2d + 1 || Max[l[[k ;; k + d - 1]]] > 0,  0,  b[n, Join[l[[1 ;; k-1]], Array[1&, d],  l[[k+d ;; 3*d]]]]]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, 1, b[n, Array[0&, 3k]]]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 30 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 29 2014
